The '''''Red Sea''' oil spill''' is a massive ongoing [[oil spill]] in the [[Red Sea]] that is now considered the largest [[offshore drilling|offshore]]spill in [[Egypt]] history. The spill is reported to have polluted around 100 miles (160 kilometers) of coastline including tourist beach resorts. Oil company officials in the port city of [[Suez]] said the spill was caused by a leak from an offshore oil platform in [[Jebel al-Zayt]] north of [[Hurghada]]. Little information is known since the spill was unreported by the company and falsely claimed to be contained by the [[Egyptian government|government]].
+
The '''''Red Sea''' oil spill''' is a massive ongoing [[oil spill]] in the [[Red Sea]] that is now considered the largest [[offshore drilling|offshore]]spill in [[Egypt]] history. The spill is reported to have polluted around 100 miles (160 kilometers) of coastline including tourist beach resorts. Oil company officials in the port city of [[Suez]] said the spill was caused by a leak from an offshore oil platform in [[Jebel al-Zayt]] north of [[Hurghada]]. Little information is known since the spill was unreported by the company and falsely claimed to be contained by the [[Egyptian government|government]]<ref>{{cite news | author=AFP | title=Egypt oil spill threatens Red Sea marine life | url=http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20100620/ts_afp/egyptenvironmentpollutionoil_20100620144044| work=AFP | date=20 June 2010| accessdate=21 June 2010}}</ref>
  +
<ref>{{cite new | author=Salah Nasrawi | title=Environmentalists Say Red Sea Oil Spill Continuing | url=http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127987325 | work=NPR | date=21 June 2010| accessdate=21 June 2010}}</ref>.
